pesticide.PPE: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants; Shoes and socks; Waterproof gloves; Protective eyewear (goggles, face shield, or safety glasses); Chemical-resistant apron when mixing or loading, cleaning up spills or equipment, or otherwise exposed to the concentrate.

Active_Ingredients.name: 2,4-Dichlorophenoxyacetic acid, choline salt
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: 2,4-D mimics the naturally occurring plant auxins and overloads the plant’s auxin balance affecting vital processes, such as cell division and elongation, resulting in abnormal growth and plant death.

Safety_Information.general_Info: May be fatal if swallowed. Causes substantial but temporary eye injury. Harmful if absorbed through skin. Prolonged or frequently repeated skin contact may cause allergic reactions in some individuals. Do not get in eyes or on clothing. Avoid contact with skin.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Have the product container or label with you when calling poison control center or doctor or going for treatment. You may also contact 1-800-992-5994 for emergency medical treatment information.

Application_Info.max_product_per_acre_per_season: 4.0 lbs ae per acre per year
4.0 lbs ae per acre per year
6.0 pints (2.8 lbs ae) per acre per year
Application_Info.application_Method: Directed or shielded application in the spring.

Application_Info.max_product_per_acre_per_season: 6.0 pints (2.8 lbs ae) per acre per year
Application_Info.application_Method: Directed application to row middles in summer or fall after harvest.

Application_Info.max_product_per_acre_per_season: 3.6 pints per acre per use season
Application_Info.application_Method: Apply after crop is fully tillered (usually 4 to 8 inches high) but not forming joints in the stem.

Application_Info.max_product_per_acre_per_season: 3.6 pints per acre per use season
Application_Info.application_Method: Apply after crop is fully tillered (usually 4 to 8 inches high) but not forming joints in the stem.
Apply to established plantings when strawberries have gone into dormancy or soon after the last picking.
